variant.question: Which restrictions apply to licence holders aged between 60 and less than 65 in commercial air transport?

options.text: No restrictions if the other crew member is younger than 40 years.
Multi-pilot crew only.
Multi-pilot crew only and the other flight crew member has to be a Captain.
Multi-pilot crew only and the other flight crew member must be younger than 60 years.

variant.question: According to EASA FCL: The holder of a pilot licence who has attained the age of \_\_\_ years shall not act as a pilot of an aircraft engaged in commercial air transport.
According EASA AIRCREW regulation, the minimum and maximum age of the pilot holding a CPL for aeroplanes or helicopters is:

options.text: 21 and 65 years.
18 and 64 years.
21 and 64 years.
18 and 60 years.

variant.question: At what age shall the holder of a pilot licence NOT act as a pilot of an aeroplane or helicopter engaged in commercial air transport?

options.text: 65 years
62 years
58 years
60 years

variant.question: According to the relevant FCL requirements, one of the privileges of the holder of an aeroplane Commercial Pilot Licence is to act as pilot-in-command on any..

options.text: aeroplane engaged in operations other than commercial air transportation.
aeroplane engaged in commercial air transportation.
aeroplane certificated for single pilot operation other than in commercial air transportation.
aircraft.

variant.question: According to Part-FCL, what documents shall always be carried by the pilot when exercising the privileges of the flight crew licence?

options.text: The pilot’s valid flight crew licence, his/her up-to-date flight time records, and a valid personnel personal identification document containing his/her photo.
The pilot’s valid medical certificate, a recent passport photo, and up-to-date flight time records.
The pilot’s valid flight crew licence, his/her valid medical certificate, and a personal identification document containing his/her photo.
The pilot’s valid flight crew licence, his/her valid medical certificate, a recent passport photo, and up-to-date flight time records.

variant.question: According to SERA, what documents shall a flight crew member carry when performing a flight?

options.text: A valid flight crew licence, a valid medical certificate and a form of photo ID.
A valid flight crew licence, updated time records, passport, VISA.
A valid flight crew licence, updated time records, a valid photo ID.
A valid flight crew licence, updated time records, insurance records.

It is the period between the end of evening civil twilight and the beginning of morning civil twilight or such other period between sunset and sunrise as may be prescribed by the appropriate authority.
It is the period between sunset and sunrise.
Occurs from 30 minutes after sunset until 30 minutes after sunrise.
During the hours of darkness.

variant.question: An applicant for a commercial pilot licence aeroplane shall have completed in aeroplanes not less than:

options.text: 15 hours of cross country flight time as pilot-in-command including a cross country flight not less than 540 km (300NM)
10 hours of cross country flight time as pilot-in-command including a cross country flight not less than 540 km (300NM)
20 hours of cross country flight time as pilot-in-command including a cross country flight not less than 540 km (300NM)
25 hours of cross country flight time as pilot-in-command including a cross country flight not less than 540 km (300NM)
